histogram.name: OfflineIndicator.ConnectivityChanged.DeviceState.Offline
histogram.summary: For OfflineIndicatorV2, records whether the native browser controls can be animated and whether the omnibox is focused. Recorded when the device goes offline.

histogram.name: OfflineIndicator.ConnectivityChanged.DeviceState.Online
histogram.summary: For OfflineIndicatorV2, records whether the native browser controls can be animated and whether the omnibox is focused. Recorded when the device goes online.

histogram.name: OfflineIndicator.CTR
histogram.summary: Records events related to click through rate (CTR) calculation for Offline Indicator UI. The CTR can be calculated by computing Clicked/Displayed.

histogram.name: OfflineIndicator.ShownDurationV2
histogram.summary: The duration the offline indicator was shown. Recorded when the offline indicator stops being shown. There are two differences between this histogram and OfflineIndicator.ShownDuration: 1) the maximum bucket size and total number of buckets are higher in this histogram, and 2) this histogram is persisted in perfs. The second point means that if the user backgrounds then kills Chrome when the Offline Indicator was shown, then we will still record a sample. Note that in this case, when the user opens Chrome again and if the Offline Indicator is shown, then it will be treated as a continuation from before Chrome was killed.

histogram.name: OfflineIndicator.ShownDurationV2.InForegroundWithoutBeingBackgrounded
histogram.summary: The duration the offline indicator was shown and Chrome was in the foreground. Samples are only recorded to this histogram if Chrome was never in the background while the offline indicator was shown. This is recoreded when the offline indicator stops being shown. The data for this histogram is persisted in perfs, so if Chrome is killed, then we will still record a sample. Note that in this case, when the user opens Chrome again and the offline indicator is shown, then it will be treated as a continuation from before Chrome was killed.

histogram.name: OfflineIndicator.ShownDurationV2.NumTimesBackgrounded
histogram.summary: The number of times Chrome was backgrounded while the offline indicator was shown. This is recorded every time the offline indicator stops being shown. The data for this histogram is persisted in perfs, so if Chrome is killed, then we will still record a sample. Note that in this case, when the user opens Chrome again and the offline indicator is shown, then it will be treated as a continuation from before Chrome was killed.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.AccessPageCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times an offline page is accessed. Events are reported per offline pages namespace.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ArchiveManager.ArchiveDirsCreationResult2
histogram.obsolete: Obsoleted April 2023. Histogram was removed after expiration.
histogram.summary: This is recorded every time the archive directory is being created. It doesn't include the case which the archive directory exists. It has suffixes indicating results for temporary or persistent archives directories.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.ImmediateStart.AvailableRequestCount
histogram.summary: Number of queued background load requests available for processing when processing starts immediately (vs. scheduled). This is for non-svelte devices (where svelte is determined by base::SysInfo::IsLowEnd()).

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.LoadingErrorStatusCode
histogram.summary: The combined http and net error codes that caused a page load failure.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.CachedOfflineStatusValid
histogram.summary: Whether the offline page status cached for a given tab agrees with the true value. Recorded with 1/100 probability each time the offline status for a tab is checked.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.CleanupThumbnails.Count
histogram.summary: Number of thumbnails removed by the thumbnail cleanup task.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ConsistencyCheck.Persistent.Result
histogram.summary: Result of persistent page consistency check.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ConsistencyCheck.Temporary.Result
histogram.summary: Result of temporary page consistency check.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DidNavigationThrottleCancelNavigation
histogram.summary:
Whether or not the OfflinePageNavigationThrottle canceled a navigation request. Requests are only canceled if and only if the navigation request was initiated by the renderer and the request headers contain the "X-Chrome-offline" header.
This histogram is recorded each time Chrome tries to create an OfflinePageNavigationThrottle, which only happens on Android (since Offline Pages is only enabled there).

histogram.name: OfflinePages.LastN.IsSavingSamePage
histogram.summary: Upon starting saving a new last_n offline page snapshot, report if that is being done for a page that is new (a navigation happened) or for one that has been previously saved in the same session (no navigation happened). This metric will assist in determining if there is the need to better track actual content changes in pages saved more than once by last_n.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.OfflineUsage
histogram.summary: Counts user-days when Chrome was used in specific ways regarding navigation to online and offline content. Buckets are mutually exclusive so that only one bucket is incremented per reported day. This metric is not recorded to UMA immediately due to potential data loss while offline. So day counters are persisted to prefs and reported to the histogram only when the next UMA data upload is likely to succeed. For more details see: https://goo.gl/GJXwFe.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.OfflineUsage.NotOfflineResilient
histogram.summary:
Counts user-days when Chrome was used in specific ways regarding navigation to online and offline content. Buckets are mutually exclusive so that only one bucket is incremented per reported day.
This metric is a mirror of OfflinePages.OfflineUsage but it doesn't use any of the offline resilient mechanisms that one has. Ideally both should report exactly the same values but it is expected this one will lose more samples.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.PageAccessInterval
histogram.summary: Length of time between accesses to an offline page. This is the same time period used for expiring temporary pages. This metric is recorded when an offline page is accessed.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.PageSize
histogram.summary: Size of the saved copy of an offline page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.PublishArchive.PublishSource
histogram.summary: When publishing an offline page, a page might not be found. This returns the publishing path that was used (ex: by Guid or by OfflineId).

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SavePage.PercentLoaded
histogram.summary: The percentage of the page load completed when the button to save an offline page is pressed.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SQLStorage.StoreEvent
histogram.summary: Used as a counter to track different events related to offline page store inner working.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.TrustStateOnOpen
histogram.summary: The trust state of the offline page. This is recorded when an offline page is being opened.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.WebsiteSettings.OpenOnlineButtonVisible
histogram.summary: Indicates whether Open online was visible in Page Info popup, when it was shown for an offline page. (The button is visible only when Chrome is connected when the Page Info popup is opened for offline page.)
